newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Motorola to launch dual band cellular phone.
newsitem.headline: Motorola to launch dual band cellular phone.

text.p: Motorola Inc's Asia cellular subscriber unit said on Friday it was launching the world's first cellular telephone capable of operating on either GSM or PCN networks.
Motorola said in a statement the Dual Band 880 phone would allow roaming between the two networks -- the first such dual capability to be offered in a single phone unit.
Previously roaming had only been possible if users switched network access smart cards to separate phones operating on the different networks, the statement said.
Motorola revealed the launch plans ahead of the Asia Telecom '97 trade show which kicks off on Monday, June 9.

The telephone's Asia launch follows news in May that UK cellular phone operator Orange Plc was introducing a dual frequency handset from Motorola that would allow free roaming between the U.S., Europe and Asia by the end of 1997.
Motorola said it expected the phones to be available in Singapore through Singapore Telecommunications Ltd (SingTel) from the fourth quarter of the year.
SingTel said in a separate statement the tie-up would make it one of the first operators in the world to offer the dual band service.
